org.sm.fraxion.fractals

Class AConvergentFractalIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sm.fraxion.fractals.AFractalIterator
      • org.sm.fraxion.fractals.AConvergentFractalIterator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NewtonRaphsonFixedPolynomial1FractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonFixedPolynomial2FractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonFixedPolynomial3FractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonFixedPolynomial4FractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonPowerFractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonPowerPolynomialFractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonTrigonometricPowerMultiSineFractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonTrigonometricPowerMultiSineOffsetFractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonTrigonometricPowerSineFractalIterator, NewtonRaphsonTrigonometricPowerSineOffsetFractalIterator, NovaFractalIterator

    public abstract class AConvergentFractalIterator
extends AFractalIterator
    The AConvergentFractalIterator class provides a base class for convergent fractals (e.g., Newton-Raphson).

    Note that this is an abstract class.

    Version:
    16/12/2014
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateOrbit

        protected org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber evaluateOrbit(org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber z,
                                                                  org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber c)
        Evaluates the orbit of the specified complex variable z.

        By default, this method calculates a complex numerical derivate for an arbitrary function, and then performs relaxed Newton-Raphson root finding.

        Parameters:
        z - the complex variable z
        c - the complex parameter c
        Returns:
        the evaluated complex variable z

      • initialiseIterations

        protected org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber initialiseIterations(org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber z,
                                                                         org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber c)
        Initialises the first iteration.

        This method returns c by default, thereby overriding user-specified initial starting values (making the dual fractal empty).

        Parameters:
        z - the complex variable z
        c - the complex parameter c
        Returns:
        the initialised complex variable z

      • iterate

        protected IterationResult iterate(org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber z,
                                  org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber c,
                                  boolean saveOrbit)
        Helper method for a general iteration with the Newton-Raphson root finding algorithm.
        Specified by:
        iterate in class AFractalIterator
        Parameters:
        z - the complex variable z
        c - the complex parameter c
        saveOrbit - a boolean indicating whether or not the orbit should be saved
        Returns:
        the iteration result associated with the forward orbit of the complex variable starting point due to the specified complex number

      • setAlpha

        public final void setAlpha(org.sm.smtools.math.complex.ComplexNumber alpha)
        Sets the alpha used for the relaxed Newton/Raphson root finding process.

        The default value is 1.0; good values lie in the interval (0.1 - 0.85i) -> (1.85 + 0.85i).

        Parameters:
        alpha - the alpha used for the relaxed Newton/Raphson root finding process
